content.raw:
hi @TwoBit01, which version of Ignition Transport are you using? If you're using > 2.0.0 Ignition-msgs should be already a dependency.

If you're using > 2.0.0, the `#include` for your message should be `#include <ignition/msgs/stringmsg.pb.h>` or `<ignition/msgs.hh>`. See the [example/](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/src/7d7777533017a0cb8912609e23ea5386d9fb1ff3/example/publisher.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) directory.

Could you elaborate which part of the documentation should we improve?
content.html:
hi @TwoBit01, which version of Ignition Transport are you using? If you're using > 2.0.0 Ignition-msgs should be already a dependency.

If you're using > 2.0.0, the #include for your message should be #include <ignition/msgs/stringmsg.pb.h> or <ignition/msgs.hh>. See the example/ directory.

Could you elaborate which part of the documentation should we improve?

content.raw:
We have updated the documentation on the `default` branch. Could you give it another try? (don't forget to refresh your browser). Keep in mind the following:

* [http://ignition-transport.readthedocs.io/en/default/](http://ignition-transport.readthedocs.io/en/default/): This is the documentation for the last development branch (`default`).

* [http://ignition-transport.readthedocs.io/en/ign-transport2/](http://ignition-transport.readthedocs.io/en/ign-transport2/): This is the documentation for the version 2, only released from the OSRF repository.

* We don't have a similar documentation for the version 1 (which is included in Ubuntu and Debian). Please, take a look at the [examples directory](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/raw/ign-transport1/example/) for learning how to use it.
content.html:
We have updated the documentation on the default branch. Could you give it another try? (don't forget to refresh your browser). Keep in mind the following:

  • http://ignition-transport.readthedocs.io/en/default/: This is the documentation for the last development branch (default).

  • http://ignition-transport.readthedocs.io/en/ign-transport2/: This is the documentation for the version 2, only released from the OSRF repository.

  • We don't have a similar documentation for the version 1 (which is included in Ubuntu and Debian). Please, take a look at the examples directory for learning how to use it.

content.raw:
Here are my learning Ignition transport is a working solution that removes the need to work on the low level details. If we use ignition transport use ignition messages for the data structures.This contains most of the definitions Gazbeo uses - LidarScan Vector3d etc

1. The cmake must be changed to find the IGN\_MSGS package
2. The .pb.h file for the msgs can then be included to the simulation plugin as well as the external standalone executable.
3. The ignition transport library install went well . I can send msgs from windows to linux....

‌

1. installing ign-msgs is difficult with the documentation , ign-cmake is a dependency not mentioned, the install path needs updating, ign-msgs1 needs ign-math4 , which does not build , the protobufversion in the documentaion is incorrect, Path forward is to create a custom message and not use ign-msgs. This appears doable

‌
